byline.contributor: Michael S. Schmidt contributed reporting from Washington. Yufan Huang contributed research from Beijing.

abstract: Center for Strategic and International Studies in Washington, DC, issues report stating that China may be building series of radar facilities on artificial islands in South China Sea
lead_paragraph: The report comes less than a week after the United States said that China appeared to have deployed missiles on another island in the disputed sea.

headline.main: Possible Radar Suggests Beijing Wants ‘Effective Control’ in South China Sea
headline.print_headline: Report Shows China Building Radar Facilities

snippet: The report comes less than a week after the United States said that China appeared to have deployed missiles on another island in the disputed sea.
